creditline: The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund
description: Louis-Philippe, King of the French, Ferdinand Philippe Louis Charles Henri, Duc d'Orléans, and Louis Charles Philippe Raphaël d'Orléans, Duc de Némours.
text: Louis-Philippe became King of France following the Revolution of 1830. He was dethroned during the international uprisings of 1848, which caused widespread social disruptions such as that recorded by Daumier in his bronze relief above.
title: Louis-Philippe and His Sons, the Dukes of Chartres and of Némours
